newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian shares close mixed in small volumes.
newsitem.headline: Russian shares close mixed in small volumes.

text.p: Leading Russian shares closed mixed on Tuesday on fragile Western demand and small volumes, traders said.
The Russian Trading System index of 21 issues rose by 0.79 percent to 183.39 on volume of $7.56 million.

"It is a very, very quiet market," said Martin Diggle from Brunswick brokerage. "Prices were marked up this morning, but there was no demand from the West and the prices fell again in the afternoon on very small volume."
Sergei Kosynkin, a trader from Bank Menatep, said Russian brokers did not want to sell shares as yields on Treasury bills fall, making stocks more attractive.
"The West is not initiating demand and our people do not want to sell hoping for the demand," he said. "Yields on the T-bill market are such that it is possible to invest in shares."
Diggle said the market would remain firm in the next few days, but he was waiting for more Western demand in mid-September.
"This week it'll be fairly quiet but I think the market should be generally firm," he said. "The market believes that there will be more Western funds coming -- it is a question of when, not if."
Mosenergo closed at $0.966 after $0.971 at Monday's close, LUKoil fell to $9.85 from $9.98, Norilsk Nickel rose to $7.75 from $7.70 and Rostelekom rose to $2.58 from $2.57.
Petersburg Telephone shed much of Monday's gains to close at $16.05 after $17.60.
